intro: Mallostoma cachirensis, commonly known as the Cachira bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and has hairy stems and leaves adapted to cold and dry conditions. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Mallostoma cachirensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native habitat.
